headline.main: Death of N. B. Blunt, Esq.

docs.lead_paragraph: We are pained to learn that N. Bow DITCH BLUNT, Esq., District Attorney for the City and County of New-York, died yesterday morning at Lebanon Springs, where he was staying for relaxation with his family. His death was rumored

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN--MORTALITY.--The Health Officer reports 221 deaths for the week ending Saturday last--116 males, 105 females--adults, 107; children, 114.
docs.snippet: THE CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN--MORTALITY.--The Health Officer reports 221 deaths for the week ending Saturday last--116 males, 105 females--adults, 107; children, 114.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; The Official Gazette--The Negro Organization--Surrouder of Slaves, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: In issue of the 9th, "Our Journal" gives us "the secret of our confidence and our strength." The national "honor, for which we ought to sacrifice the last stiver and the last man," is the hypothesis; showing the quality of our mettle "without concealment-with justice on our side-the opinion of Europe-the favor of the world of the world-our ancient alliances; who would not approach such a desperate struggle with terror?"

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: In the dearth of city news which Tele graph reporters do not transmit, I may write some thing of the crops in Ohio, that will be profitable. The Wheat crop of Ohio is an important one, because in this State is raised about one-fifth of all the wheat produced in the United States. The aggregate in 1850 was, of acres planted, 1,818,100, bushels produced, 31,119,139. 1851, acres

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times : I do hot pretend to know much of the interior of our much vaunted Public Schools-in fact, I was never inside one of them, to my recollection. But, if the school on the corner of First avenue and Ninth street is a specimen of the rest, there is at least one feature which demands consideration and reform. s passing the 'Institu-

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; CHARGES AGAINST THE CORPORATION ATTORNEY. Investigation Before the Committee of the Board of Aldermen. FIFTH DAY--SATURDAY. HEALTH OF THE CITY. Half Million Trust Case. Board of Health. City Mortality.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Committee of the Board of Aldermen, appointed to investigate charges preferred by Dr. INGRAHAM against WM. B. HASKIN, Corporation Attorney, reassembled on Saturday at 2 P. M. Present--Aldermen BLUNT and KELLY. The Chairman (Alderman BLUNT) asked the parties whether they were willing to proceed in the absence of Alderman LORD.

headline.main: Health of Norfolk--Arrival of the U.S. Brig Perry--Sailing of the U.S. Ship Constitution, & c.

NEW-YORK CITY.; THE CHOLERA HOSPITAL. Indignation Meeting in the Fifth Ward. Passage of Strong Resolutions. Letter from Alexander Heilbronu-Discipline of an English Prison. LETTER FROM HEILBRONN. The Late Dr. Vargas. The California Ticket Swindle. Military. THE BININGER GUARD. Board of Councilmen. SUICIDE WITH LAUDANUM. SUICIDE OF A LUNATIC. KILLED BY A HORSE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The citizens of the Fifth Ward held an indignation meeting last evening, at the Fifth Ward Hotel, to remonstrate against the occupation of the building No. 105 Franklin-street as a Cholera Hospital. The attendance was large and respectable. The meeting was organized by the selection of JAMES THOMPSON, Esq.; as President, and CHARLES TAPPEN, Secretary.
